focus-ring.$description: Used for focus states in components. For example toggles and checkboxes.

focus-ring-shadow-xs.$description: Used for focus states in components that also require a shadow. For example, buttons and tabs.

focus-ring-shadow-xs-skeuomorphic.$description:
Used for focus states in components that also require a shadow and a subtle skeuomorphic effect. For example, buttons and tabs.

This can be replaced with focus-ring-shadow-xs if you prefer a flat style.

focus-ring-shadow-sm.$description: Used for focus states in components that also require a shadow. For example, buttons and tabs.

focus-ring-error.$description: Used for destructive or error focus states in components. For example, destructive button links.

focus-ring-error-shadow-xs.$description: Used for destructive or error focus states in components that also require a shadow. For example, destructive buttons.

focus-ring-error-shadow-xs-skeuomorphic.$description:
Used for focus states in destructive or error components that also require a shadow and a subtle skeuomorphic effect. For example, destructive buttons.

This can be replaced with focus-ring-error-shadow-xs if you prefer a flat style.

shadow-xs.$description: Shadows allow you to add depth and realism to designs by positioning elements on a z-axis.

shadow-xs-skeuomorphic.$description:
Used to create a subtle skeuomorphic effect in components such as buttons and tabs.

This can be removed or replaced with shadow-xs if you prefer a flat style.

shadow-sm.$description: Shadows allow you to add depth and realism to designs by positioning elements on a z-axis.

shadow-md.$description: Shadows allow you to add depth and realism to designs by positioning elements on a z-axis.

shadow-lg.$description: Shadows allow you to add depth and realism to designs by positioning elements on a z-axis.

shadow-xl.$description: Shadows allow you to add depth and realism to designs by positioning elements on a z-axis.

shadow-2xl.$description: Shadows allow you to add depth and realism to designs by positioning elements on a z-axis.

shadow-3xl.$description: Shadows allow you to add depth and realism to designs by positioning elements on a z-axis.
